sen.j: 土田 友湖（つちだ ゆうこ）は、千家十職の一つ、袋師。
sen.e: Yuko TSUCHIDA is a fukuroshi (a craftman who makes pouches), one of Sen-ke Jisshiki (the ten artisan families which contributed to the existence of the Omote Sen-ke).
Yuko TSUCHIDA is a fukuroshi (a craftman who makes pouches), one of Sen-ke Jisshiki (the ten artisan families which contributed to the existence of the Omote Sen-ke).
Yuko TSUCHIDA is a fukuroshi (a craftsman who makes pouches), one of the Jisshiki (the ten artisan families which contributed to the existence of the Omote Senke) in House of Sen.
sen.cmt: craftsmanスペル訂正しました。千家→House of Senより、one of the Jisshiki (the ten artisan families which contributed to the existence of the Omote Senke) in House of Senとしました。ハイフン削除しました。

sen.j: 二代以降、当主の通称は半四郎であり隠居して剃髪すると友湖を名乗る。
sen.e: Since the second family head, common name of the successive family heads has been Hanshiro and they have called themselves Yuko after they retired and took the tonsure.
Since the second family head,the common name of the successive family heads has been Hanshiro and they have called themselves Yuko after they retired and took up the tonsure.
Since the second family head, the common name of the successive family heads has been Hanshiro and they have called themselves Yuko after they retired and took up the tonsure.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 五代までは仕服を生業としたが、以降は茶道具の茶入の仕覆（しふく）や、服紗、角帯などを作る。
sen.e: The family's occupation was sewing kimono (clothes) up to the era of fifth family head, but since then, the family has been engaged in the production of tea utensils such as shifuku (a pouch to be used for putting in a tea container), fukusa (silk cloth to be used in tea ceremony) and Kakuobi (Japanese belt (obi) for men).

The family's occupation was sewing kimono (clothes) up to the era of the fifth family head, but since then, the family has been engaged in the production of tea utensils such as shifuku (a pouch to be used for putting in a tea container), fukusa (silk cloth to be used in tea ceremony) and Kakuobi (Japanese belt (obi) for men).

The family's occupation was sewing kimono (clothes) up to the era of the fifth family head, but since then, the family has been engaged in the production of tea utensils such as shifuku (a pouch to be used for putting in a tea container), fukusa (silk cloth to be used in tea ceremony) and Kakuobi (Japanese belt (obi) for men).

sen.j: 2007年現在、当代は十二代土田友湖（1965年に襲名）。
sen.e: The family head as of 2007 is the 12th Yuko TSUCHIDA (he succeeded in 1965).
The family head as of 2007 is the 12th Yuko TSUCHIDA (he succeeded in 1965).
The family head as of 2007 is the 12th Yuko TSUCHIDA (he succeeded in 1965).

sen.j: 家系
sen.e: The family line
The family line
The family line

sen.j: 土田家の祖先は近江国蒲生郡土田村の出身の侍・土田七大夫で、後に初代彦根藩主・井伊直政に仕官、鉄砲組頭を代々務めた家柄と伝えられている。
sen.e: It has been handed down that the ancestor of Tsuchida family was Hichidayu TSUCHIDA, a samurai (warrior) hailed from Tsuchida-mura, Gamo-gun, Omi Province, and the family later became a vassal of Naomasa II, the first lord of the Hikone domain, and served as teppo-kumigashira (the head of gun troop) successively.

It has been handed down that the ancestor of Tsuchida family was Hichidayu TSUCHIDA, a samurai (warrior) hailed from Tsuchida-mura, Gamo-gun, Omi Province, and the family later became a vassal of Naomasa II, the first lord of the Hikone domain, and served as teppo-kumigashira (the head of gun troop) successively.

It has been handed down that the ancestor of Tsuchida family was Shichdayu TSUCHIDA, a samurai (warrior) hailed from Tsuchida-mura, Gamo-gun, Omi Province, and the family later became a vassal of Naomasa II, the first lord of the Hikone Domain, and served as teppo-kumigashira (the head of gun troop) successively.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字にしました。Hichidayu→Shichidayuに訂正しました。

sen.j: 七大夫の4代後の子孫・半平は本来跡取りであったが、実母が早くに亡くなり、後妻に入った継母が男子を生んだ。
sen.e: Although Hanpei, the fourth descendant from Hichidayu, was to be a successor, his mother died early and his step mother gave birth to a baby boy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although Hanpei, the fourth descendant from Hichidayu, was to be a successor, his mother died early and his step mother gave birth to a baby boy.
Although Hanpei, the fourth descendant from Shichidayu, was to be a successor, his mother died early and his step mother gave birth to a baby boy.

sen.j: そのため、異母弟に家を譲って武士を廃業、「越後屋半兵衛」と名乗って西陣織仲買人となった。
sen.e: Under such situation, Hanpei transferred the headship of the family to his half brother with the same father, gave up the status of samurai and became a broker of Nishijin-brocade with the name of "Echigoya Hanbei".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Under such situation, Hanpei transferred the headship of the family to his half brother with the same father, gave up the status of samurai and became a broker of Nishijin-brocade with the name of "Echigoya Hanbei".

Under such situation, Hanpei transferred the headship of the family to his half brother with the same father, gave up the status of samurai and became a broker of Nishijin-brocade with the name of 'Echigoya Hanbei.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: その傍ら袋物の仕立ての修行をし、表千家六代・覚々斎に引き立てられて茶入の仕覆などを縫うようになった。
sen.e: While working as a broker, he studied sewing pouches and started to produce shifuku for tea containers with the support of the sixth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Kakukakusai.
While working as a broker, he studied sewing pouches and started to produce shifuku for tea containers with the support of the sixth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Kakukakusai.
While working as a broker, he studied sewing pouches and started to produce shifuku for tea containers with the support of the sixth grand master of Omote Senke, Kakukakusai.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。ハイフン削除しました。

sen.j: 土田家歴代
sen.e: Succesesive family heads of Tsuchida family
Succesesive family heads of Tsuchida family
Succesesive family heads of Tsuchida family

sen.j: 初代・友湖（1687年 - 1757年、土田七太夫 通称：半平・勘平 号：友湖・不染斎）
sen.e: The first ・ Yuko (1687-1757, Hichidayu TSUCHIDA, common name : Hanpei・Kanbei, go (pen name) : Yuko ・ Fusensai)
The first ・ Yuko (1687-1757, Hichidayu TSUCHIDA, common name : Hanpei・Kanbei, go (pen name) : Yuko ・ Fusensai)
The first Yuko (1687 - 1757, Shichidayu TSUCHIDA, common name: Hanpei or Kanbei, go (pen name): Yuko or Fusensai)
sen.cmt: ・削除しました。Hichidayu→Shichidayuに訂正しました。スペース補足しました。・をorに訂正しました。余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 西陣織の仲買人だったが、袋師・亀岡宗理の弟子となってその家業を継いだ。
sen.e: Although he was a broker of Nishijin-brocade initially, he later became a disciple of fukuroshi Sori KAMEYAMA and succeeded his family business.
Although he was a broker of Nishijin-brocade initially, he later became a disciple of fukuroshi Sori KAMEYAMA and succeeded his family business.
Although he was a broker of Nishijin-brocade initially, he later became a disciple of fukuroshi Sori KAMEYAMA and succeeded his family business.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 表千家の六代・覚々斎の時に千家の袋師となり、後に七代・如心斎より友湖の号を贈られた。
sen.e: He became fukuroshi for Sen-ke in the era of the sixth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Kakukakusai, and was given the go of Yuko by the seventh grandmaster, Joshinsai.
He became fukuroshi for Sen-ke in the era of the sixth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Kakukakusai, and was given the go of Yuko by the seventh grandmaster, Joshinsai.
He became fukuroshi for House of Sen in the era of the sixth grand master of Omote Senke, Kakukakusai, and was given the go of Yuko by the seventh grandmaster, Joshinsai.
sen.cmt: 千家→House of Senハイフン削除しました。

sen.j: 初代不染斎の子、初代在世中に没す。
sen.e: He was a son of Fusensai, the first, and died while Fusansai was in life.

sen.j: 二代半四郎の姉・くに。
sen.e: She was an elder sister of Hanshiro, the second, and her real name was Kuni.
She was an elder sister of Hanshiro, the second, and her real name was Kuni.

sen.j: 三代半四郎の子供が幼少のため、表千家八代・ソツ啄斎の命により家業継承。
sen.e: As the children of Hanshiro, the third family head, were very young, she succeeded the family business at the behest of the eighth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Sottakusai.
As the children of Hanshiro, the third family head, were very young, she succeeded the family business at the behest of the eighth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Sottakusai.

sen.j: 1788年、天明の大火により家屋を焼失するが、ソツ啄斎の援助により再建。
sen.e: Although the family's house was burnt down in 1788 because of the Great Fire of Tenmei, she reconstructed it with the help of Sottakusai.
Although the family's house was burnt down in 1788 because of the Great Fire of Tenmei, she reconstructed it with the help of Sottakusai.

sen.j: 三代一得斎の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Ittokusa, the third family head.

sen.j: この頃、室町一文字屋三右衛門、笹屋勘右衛門など服紗を扱っていた家が断絶したため、表千家九代・了々斎の計らいにより服紗も扱い始める。
sen.e: Because families which had been engaged in producing Fukusa, such as Muromachi Ichimonjiya Sanemon and Sasaya Kanuemon, became extinct around that time, he started to produce fukusa through the good offices of the ninth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Ryoryo-sai.

Because families which had been engaged in producing Fukusa, such as Muromachi Ichimonjiya Sanemon and Sasaya Kanuemon, became extinct around that time, he started to produce fukusa through the good offices of the ninth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Ryoryo-sai.

Because families which had been engaged in producing Fukusa, such as Muromachi Ichimonjiya Sanemon and Sasaya Kanemon, became extinct around that time, he started to produce fukusa through the good offices of the ninth grand master of Omote Senke, Ryoryosai.
sen.cmt: KanuemonをKanemonに訂正しました。ハイフン削除しました。

sen.e: The sixth ・ Hanshiro (1803 - 1883)

sen.e: He was a son of the fifth.

sen.j: 天明の大火で焼失した家系図や秘伝書の再編さんを薦めるが、蛤御門の変に遭遇、再び家屋及び家伝などの一切を消失。
sen.e: Although he strived to restore the family's genealogical table and hidensho (a book of family's secret technique) which had been burnt down in the Great Fire of Tenmei, he encountered the Conspiracy of Hamaguri-gomon Gate and again lost everything including his house and a book of family tradition.

Although he strived to restore the family's genealogical table and hidensho (a book of family's secret technique) which had been burnt down in the Great Fire of Tenmei, he encountered the Conspiracy of Hamaguri-gomon Gate and again lost everything including his house and a book on family tradition.

sen.e: He married into the family of Asa, the eldest daughter of the seventh.

sen.j: 養父・聴雪を亡くした一月後に没す。

sen.j: 22才の若さで亡くなる。
sen.e: He died as early as at 22 years old.

sen.j: 七代聴雪の長女、八代の妻である阿さ。

sen.j: 夫・長男・次男の早世及び後継者の三男が幼少のため、家督継承。
sen.e: She succeeded the headship of the family because her husband, eldest son and second son died early and her third son was very young.
She succeeded the headship of the family because her husband, eldest son and second son died early and her third son was very young.

sen.j: 八代淡雪の三男、良三。
sen.e: He was a third son of Tansetsu, the eighth, and his real name was Ryozo.
He was the third son of Tansetsu, the eighth, and his real name was Ryozo.
He was the third son of Tansetsu, the eighth, and his real name was Ryozo.

sen.j: 昭和15年、十代当主で母の阿さが亡くなったため家督継承するが、太平洋戦争勃発により幾度も応召される。
sen.e: Although he succeeded the headship of the family in 1940 when his mother Asa, the 10th, died, he was called up for military service for several times during the Pacific War.
Although he succeeded the headship of the family in 1940 when his mother Asa, the 10th, died, he was called up for military service several times during the Pacific War.

sen.j: 終戦後、ようやく茶道復活の兆しが出始めた昭和29年に病に倒れ、以後は入退院を繰り返し、家業に専念できぬまま世を去る。
sen.e: After the war, he succumbed to a disease in 1954 when the revival of Sado (tea ceremony) was in the bud and after repeated hospitalization, he died without being able to devote himself to family business.

After the war, he succumbed to a disease in 1954 when the revival of Sado (tea ceremony) was in the bud and after repeated hospitalization, he died without being able to devote himself to family business.
